Course Reviews

Comprehensive reviews of MEMS courses with difficulty ratings, professor insights, and prerequisites

ME 101

Core

Engineering Mechanics

Medium Difficulty

Credits: 3

Semester: 1st Year, 1st Sem

Prerequisites: None

Professors
Prof. A. Kumar Prof. S. Patel
Textbooks
  • ‚Ä¢ Engineering Mechanics by Hibbeler
  • ‚Ä¢ Vector Mechanics for Engineers
Why Take This Course?

Foundation course for all mechanical concepts. Essential for understanding statics, dynamics, and structural analysis.

Senior Insights

"Focus on free body diagrams and vector analysis. Practice problems are key to scoring well."

Read Full Review

ME 102

Core

Engineering Drawing

Easy

Credits: 2

Semester: 1st Year, 1st Sem

Prerequisites: None

Professors
Prof. R. Sharma
Textbooks
  • ‚Ä¢ Engineering Drawing by N.D. Bhatt
Why Take This Course?

Learn technical drawing skills essential for mechanical engineering. CAD software introduction included.

Senior Insights

"Practice drawing regularly. AutoCAD assignments are time-consuming but important for grades."

Read Full Review

CS 101

Core

Computer Programming

Medium Difficulty

Credits: 3

Semester: 1st Year, 1st Sem

Prerequisites: None

Professors
Prof. M. Singh Prof. K. Verma
Textbooks
  • ‚Ä¢ C Programming by Kernighan & Ritchie
  • ‚Ä¢ Data Structures by Horowitz
Why Take This Course?

Essential programming skills for modern mechanical engineering. Useful for automation and data analysis.

Senior Insights

"Start coding early. Practice problems on platforms like HackerRank. Projects are crucial for understanding."

Read Full Review

DS 101

Minor

Introduction to Data Science

Hard

Credits: 3

Semester: 3rd Year, 1st Sem

Prerequisites: CS 101, MA 106

Professors
Prof. A. Gupta
Textbooks
  • ‚Ä¢ Introduction to Statistical Learning
  • ‚Ä¢ Python for Data Analysis
Why Take This Course?

Learn data analysis and machine learning fundamentals. Highly valued in industry and research.

Senior Insights

"Heavy workload but very rewarding. Start learning Python and statistics beforehand."

Read Full Review

ME 201

Core

Thermodynamics

Hard

Credits: 3

Semester: 2nd Year, 1st Sem

Prerequisites: ME 101, MA 106

Professors
Prof. S. Reddy Prof. P. Joshi
Textbooks
  • ‚Ä¢ Thermodynamics by Cengel & Boles
  • ‚Ä¢ Engineering Thermodynamics by Moran
Why Take This Course?

Core mechanical engineering concept. Essential for heat engines, refrigeration, and energy systems.

Senior Insights

"Concept-heavy course. Focus on understanding cycles and property tables. Practice numerical problems extensively."

Read Full Review

ME 301

Elective

Machine Design

Medium Difficulty

Credits: 3

Semester: 3rd Year, 2nd Sem

Prerequisites: ME 101, ME 201

Professors
Prof. R. Kumar
Textbooks
  • ‚Ä¢ Machine Design by Shigley
  • ‚Ä¢ Design of Machine Elements by Bhandari
Why Take This Course?

Learn practical design principles for mechanical components. Great for industry preparation.

Senior Insights

"Project-based learning. CAD software skills are a bonus. Good for mechanical design careers."
